children.subject:
Yea same when I took 127 the grading was the same for undergrad and grad. The only caveat is that grad students have to do the additional project (worth ~20% of the grade) while for undergrads it was optional (and could count for 20% of the grad if you did it, other categories reweighted appropriately)

If you are undergraduate student you take 127, and grad students take 227A (in general courses like 1xx/2xxA are the same undergrad and "mezzanine-level" grad classes).

127/227 AT are mostly or entirely similar depending on the semester. When I took it in Sp 20 everything was identical (except the grad students were on a different curve presumably). Not sure if that's still the case

history.content:
I've really been hoping to take both courses next semester but realized that they actually have overlapping schedules, and classes.berkeley.edu doesn't explicitly say that concurrent enrollment is allowed. Are the lectures recorded in both or either one of the courses, and would it be possible to enroll in both next semester?

(I saw that EECS 227AT had the same professor, location, and times as EE 127 and was allowing for time conflicts—if it is the same thing as eecs 127, could I enroll in that course instead then? Are there any differences between 127 and 227AT at all in terms of grading, homework, exams, logistics, etc.? I'm an undergrad so I think it'd be generally better for me to take undergrad courses, but I also really want to take both 126/127 simultaneously.)
history.subject: taking both eecs 126 and 127 fall 2022?
